title: Polémique 1:115–116/89–90 Severus interestingly quotes from the following two sections (7–8) in Athanasius’s De Sententia Dionysii (PG 25:489b-491b). Although Athanasius, in the passage quoted by Severus, continues to advocate for rhetorically informed, audience-based exegesis, Severus puts this passage to a very different use. Reading the passage against its grain, he recruits it as an argument for holistic, intertextual exegesis, ignoring its fundamentally historicizing orientation
